text.title: Make a Wrist Roller Out of PVC

head.s: Make a Wrist Roller Out of PVC

p.s: A wrist roller works well for exercise .
You can use PVC to make one through a fairly intermediate , yet worthy process .
It takes a lot of care and concentration and will be rewarding .

item.s: Cut the PVC pipe .
Take the pipe and cut it to a desirable length with a hacksaw .
This will be your bar and should be long enough to complete the exercise .
Cut straight across , perpendicular to the pipe .
You can sand the ends if you 'd like , but this is not necessary .
Do n't panic if you do n't have a hacksaw .
PVC is a very soft material , so you could get away with many other options .
Drill the hole for the rope .
Insert the drill bit into the drill slightly larger than the rope in order to thread the rope through .
Drill the hole through one side of the PVC pipe only in the center of the pipe .
Thread the rope through the hole .
Push your rope through until it comes out one of the ends of the PVC .
Tie the knot once the end of the rope is out .
Knot the rope to create a loop at the end and thread the end back through , then pull the rope tight .
Cut the excess rope off if you 'd like .
Pull the knot back until it reaches the hole you drilled .
The knot should be big enough that it does not come out this hole .
Attach weights .
Take the other end of the rope and loop it through the hole in the center of the weights .
Then tie a knot in order to hold the weights .
A double knot will do fine ; this is the same as the knot before but you 'll have to go through the loop twice this time .
Test your knots .
Now that everything is together , lift your weights off the ground by lifting the bar up to see if the knots hold .
If the rope snaps , you need a thicker rope .
If the knot slips , you have too much weight and you will need a different knot ( doubling up knots will make them stronger )
It is unlikely that the PVC will bend , but you could use galvanized iron pipe if it does .
It will just take more effort to drill and cut , but still doable with the same tools and method .
If everything holds , you 've just made your very own wrist roller !
Be proud and enjoy it .
You could substitute the weights with anything you want as long as you can tie it to the end of the rope .
Use caution working with drills and hacksaws .
PVC pipe ( 1 " diameter is a good size )
Rope ( should be strong enough to support weights )
Free weights ( circular kind with hole in center )
Drill with drill bits
Hacksaw
